thread.title: Trombone quartet will perform in second Hannibal Concert Association concert
thread.title_full: Trombone quartet will perform in second Hannibal Concert Association concert

title: Trombone quartet will perform in second Hannibal Concert Association concert
text: Trombone quartet will perform in second Hannibal Concert Association concert The Hannibal Concert Association presents its second concert of the 2015-2016 concert season on Oct. 26 with an internally acclaimed trombone quartet. Comment   Writer Posted Oct. 18, 2015 at 3:00 PM Posted Oct. 18, 2015 at 3:00 PM Hannibal The Hannibal Concert Association presents its second concert of the 2015-2016 concert season on Oct. 26 with an internally acclaimed trombone quartet. Maniacal 4 will perform at 7:30 p.m. at the Roland Fine Arts Center on the campus of HLGU. Without a season or patron membership, tickets are $20 for adults and $5 for students at the door. Maniacal 4 is a group of four great musicians telling one unified, inspiring musical story. They have played concerts on three continents, entertaining audiences with a wide range of styles and time periods. Well versed in classical, jazz, Latin and rock music. With all four members early in their musical careers, Maniacal 4 has the goods to become one of the finest trombone quartets performing today. Following Maniacal 4's live performances of “Bohemian Rhapsody” and “Carry On Wayward Son” during classical recitals at major international trombone festivals, the quartet went viral on YouTube, reddit and wimp.com , launching them into a new and exciting phase of their innovative quartet career. Both season and single ticket sales will be available at the door prior to the concert. Season tickets (which include admission to all series performances) are available for individuals ($50) and couple/parents w/children ($100). Season ticket holders essentially pay only $10 per concert. HCA season ticket holders also benefit from free/discounted admission to all performances of the Keokuk Concert Association and Quincy Civic Music Association. For more information regarding the Hannibal Concert Association and its concert season, contact HCA board members Mike Marx at 217-242-2505 or Sara North at 573-221-0822. A season brochure with Season and Patron membership forms is available for download at hannibalarts.com .   Writer
